==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|みん|しゅ|yomi=on}}

===Etymology===
From {{etyl|zhx|ja|sort=みんしゅ}} {{m|zh|民主}}. Repurposed in China in the mid-1860s, giving the word a new meaning, during the translation of the book ''[[w:Elements of International Law|Elements of International Law]]'' into Chinese.<ref>{{cite-web|last=Chen |first=Sheng Bao|date=1996-12-17 |url=http://www.nichibun.ac.jp/graphicversion/dbase/forum/text/fn091.html |title=中国語の中の日本語 (Chinese Borrowings from the Japanese Language), paper presented at the Japanese Language Research Forum held by the International Research Center for Japanese Studies|publisher=International Research Center for Japanese Studies|language=Japanese |accessdate=2012-06-15|quote=古代漢語のことばを利用して訳したものだが、本来の意味とは違うもの。...「民主」}}</ref>

===Pronunciation===
* [[音読み|On'yomi]]
* {{IPA|lang=ja|[miɴɕʲɯᵝ]}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|みんしゅ}}

# [[democracy]]

====Synonyms====
* {{m|ja|民主主義|tr=minshu shugi}} {{qualifier|more commonly used}}

====Compounds====
* {{l|ja|民主党|tr=minshutō|gloss=[[democratic party]]}}
* {{l|ja|民主的|tr=minshuteki|gloss=democratic}}
